standard in Government /
Corporation / Municipal / Adi

concerned_dept: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
name: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award
how: CADW through educational institutions.
desc: One boy and one girl belonging to Hindu Adi Dravidar community who secure first rank in each district in plus 2 Public Examinations. An award of Rs.2,000 is given in the first year and Rs.1,500 per annum for the succeeding five years.

concerned_dept: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
name: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award - Two (One Boy and One Girl) Hindu AD Students in each district who have secured first rank in the 12th Std Public Examinations and continue their studies.
how: Director of Adi Dravidar Welfare , Chennai-5. through the Educational Institutions.
desc: Annal Gandhi Memorial Award - Two (One Boy and One Girl) Hindu AD Students in each district who have secured first rank in the 12th Std Public Examinations and continue their studies.  AD (Hindu) Students who have secured first rank in 12th Std. exam in the dist level . Continue their studies. No income limit

how: District Adi dravidar and Tribal Welfare Officer/ Director ADW Chennai-5
desc: Adi Dravidar/ Tribal Lawyers will be eligible . Lawyers who registered their name within 5 years only eligible. Annual income of parent Rs. 1,00,000/-.

concerned_dept: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
name: Award of Rs.20,000/- to Best Writers
funding_pattern: The sel ected best writers will be awarded Rs.20,000/- for their writings
how: Will be published in the Dailies (in the month of April / May)
desc: The best 10 writers from Adi Dravidar / Tribal / Adi Dravidar converted to Christianity will be sel ected to award of the prize. One candidate from other communities will also be given this chance.10plus1 Best writers will be sel ected.

concerned_dept: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department
name: Awards to Bright Students
how: Director of Adi Dravidar Welfare , Chennai-5. through the Educational Institutions.
desc: Awards to Bright Students - First two boys and two girls in each district from each community viz., Adi Dravidar/ Tribal / Adi Dravidar Converted to Christianity who have passed 10th std., Public Examinations and continue their studies are given a sum of Rs.800/- for the first year and Rs.960/- for the next 5 years. Should have secured first and second place in the 10th Std, in the district. Continue their studies. No income limits .

concerned_dept: Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare Department

On completion of the course the students will return the books to Library. Book Bank - For the benefit of students studying in Post Graduate Courses in Medical / Engg./ Agri./ Veterinary Post Graduate Technical courses, studies in law like BL/ LLB 3 Years and 5 years / LLM - ML (2 years) Chartered Accountants, Cost Accountants Intermediate, Final MBA ( 2 years) and other equivalent studies , Bio- Science . AD/ Tribal students who are getting Government of India Scholarship only.

concerned_dept: Agriculture - Farmers Welfare Department
name: Distribution of Certified  Seeds of maize
funding_pattern: 50% of the cost of the seed subject to a maximum of Rs.1200/-per Quintal whichever is less
how:
The application is to be submitted to:

Assistant Agricultural officer at the Village Level 

Agricultural Officer / Deputy Agricultural Officer at the Block Level 

The Assistant Director of Agriculture at the Block Level 

The Joint Director of Agriculture at the District Level
desc:
All maize growing farmers are eligible to avail of the subsidy under this scheme 
in the Districts of Coimbatore, Dindigul, Erode, Dharmapuri, Krishnagiri, Namakkal, 
Perambalur, Virudhunagar, Theni, Villupuram, Vellore, Salem, Pudukkottai, Madurai, Sivagangai, Trichy, Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi. 

Preference will be given to Small/Marginal farmers
 24% flow to SC/ST farmers will be ensured 
20% flow to women farmers/ women groups

The Assistant Director of Agriculture at the Block Level

desc: Those farmers who produce and supply Foundation and Certified Class seeds to the Department are elligible to avail of the benefit

concerned_dept: Agriculture - Farmers Welfare Department
name: Farm Production System and micro enterprises - Sponsored By State Govt
funding_pattern: Subsidy :1560/-
how:
1)Chairman / District Collector,
2)Project Officer /Joint Director of Agriculture ,
DWDA, (PIA) at District level.

1)Chief Executive Officer,
State Level Nodal Agency,
Chennai-32 (at State level)
desc:
Demonstration for popularizing new crops/ varieties, and new
technologies in Agriculture and allied sectors. Diversification of
production systems like Dryland Horticulture, Agro Forestry,
Household production system,Adoption of proven technology,
activities like INM, IPM, Fodder development, Organic farming,
Multiple cropping, Improved inter cropping seed village concept,
Fisheries development in village ponds, farm ponds and tanks,
Sericulture, back yard poultry,Livestock management and other
micro enterprises etc. are carried out under this component.

concerned_dept: Agriculture - Farmers Welfare Department
org_name: SCHEMES AVAILABLE TO MICRO, SMALL AND MEDIUM ENTERPRISES IN TAMIL NADU
name: Low Tension power tariff subsidy
funding_pattern:
20% on power consumption charges for
36 months from Date of Commence
-ment of Production or date of power
connection whichever is later.
how:
1.For issue of
Eligibility Certificate
(EC)
Within three months
from the date of
commencement of
production or date of
power connection,
whichever is later.
2. For submission of
subsidy claims
The first claim should
be preferred within 30
days from the date of
issue of EC.
Subsequent claims
should be submitted
once in six months i.e.
the bills raised by
TNEB from January to
June should be
preferred before August
31st of the year and
from July to December
before 28th of February
of the succeeding year
desc:
251 industrially backward
blocks as listed in
Annexure I and
Industrial Estates
promoted by the
Government and
Agencies like SIPCOT,
TANSIDCO (excluding
industrial estates located
within the radius of 50
kms from Chennai City
Centre)

 All 385 blocks in the
State for Agro based
enterprises

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: DISTRICT LEVEL PRIZES PUBLIC EXAMINATION 10th Standard and 12th Standard
other:
1. Students should belong to BC/ MBC / DNC.
2. There is no income limit for receiving awards.
3. Students studying in Government/Government Aided/Private Schools.
4. Students should have studied Tamil as first Language.
5. State Level Topper students who are awarded prizes in Education Department are not eligible to receive prize in BC/MBC Department.
6. If more than one student secure same marks, awards are granted to all students.
how: Schools
desc:
FIRST PRIZE Four First Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.6,000/-
Rs.3,000/-
SECOND PRIZE Four Second Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.4,000/-
Rs.2,000/-
THIRD PRIZE Four Third Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.2,000/-
Rs.1,000/-

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: FREE EDUCATION SCHEME
other: Special fee and other non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and examination fee in full. Condition No conditions
how: Refer Govt.college
desc: Free education scholarship for three year U.G. degree Courses (B.A., B.Sc., and B.Com.,) Backward, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students studying in 3 year degree courses in Government and Government Aided Arts and Science Colleges.

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Free education scholarship for Professional Courses (Engineering, Medical, Agriculture, Veterinary and Law)
other:
Condition for Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students
1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2) There should be no graduate in the family.
how: Government and Government Aided Professional Colleges and in Self Financing Professional Colleges
desc: Tuition fee, Special fee and other non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and Examination fee in full.

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Free education scholarship for three year Diploma (Polytechnic Courses)
other:
Tuition fee, Special fee and non-refundable compulsory fees are paid as prescribed by Government and examination fee in full. Condition for Backward Classes, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students
1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2) There should not be any Diploma / Graduate in the family.
how: Refer in govt polytechnic
desc: Backward, Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities students studying in 3 year Diploma courses in Government and Government Aided Polytechnics.

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Grant-cum-loan scheme for small and medium farmers
how: District Collector / District Backward Classes and Minorities Welfare Officer of the concerned district
desc:

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: PERARIGNAR ANNA MEMORIAL AWARD
other: Should belong to BC/ MBC/DNC. No income limit.Rs.5000/- per annum for 4/5 years
how: PERARIGNAR ANNA MEMORIAL AWARD
desc: Perarignar Anna Memorial Award is awarded to the boys and girls who secure the first and second ranks in the 12th Public examination in each District and pursue their studies in professional colleges in Tamil Nadu.

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Postmatric Scholarship are sanctioned from 11th Standard to Research level as per the rates prescribed in the Scholarship Notitification
other:
Tuition Fee Rs.500/- at the rate of Rs.50/- per month for 10 months Examination Fee Sanctioned in full for 12th Standard Students Conditions for Backward Classes Students
1. The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2. There should be no graduate in the family.
Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities Students No conditions Special fees, Tuition
how: Refer in Govt.School
desc: Students studying in 11th and 12th std in English Medium

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: PRE-MATRIC SCHOLARSHIP SCHEME
how: Students studying from 6th to 10th std in English Medium
desc:
Tuition Fee From 6th to 8th Standard Rs.200/- at the rate of Rs.20/- per month for 10 months For 9th and 10th Standard Rs.250/- at the rate of Rs.25/- per month for 10 months Examination Fee Sanctioned in full for 10th Standard Students Conditions for Backward Classes Students
1) The income of the parents should not exceed Rs.1,00,000/-
2) There should be no graduate in the family.
Most Backward Classes and Denotified Communities Students No conditions

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Prize Schemes to the Students STATE LEVEL PRIZES
other:
1. Students should belong to BC/ MBC / DNC
2. There is no income limit for receiving awards.
3. Students studying in Government/Government Aided and Private Schools.
4. Students should have studied Tamil as first Language.
5. State Level Topper students who are awarded prizes in Education Department are not eligible to receive prize in this Department.
6. If more than one student secure same marks, awards are granted to all students.
how: Schools
desc:
FIRST PRIZE Four First Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.50,000/-
Rs.25,000/-
SECOND PRIZE Four Second Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.30,000/-
Rs.20,000/-
THIRD PRIZE Four Third Prizes for one boy and one girl from Backward Classes and one boy and one girl from Most Backward Classes / Denotified Communities.
Rs.20,000/-
Rs.15,000/-

concerned_dept: BC, MBC &  Minorities Welfare Department
name: Scheme for Meritorious students to pursue Higher Secondary Education in the best schools of TamilNadu
other:
BC ( 3 Boys and 3 Girls) MBC / DNC ( 2 Boys and 2 Girls)
Should belong to BC/MBC/ DNC/ The parental annual income should not exceed Rs.1.00 lakh
how: Schools
desc: Financial assistance is given to 10 students from each district who secure the highest marks in 10th Public examination by studying in Government High Schools to pursue their higher secondary education in the best private schools of their choice in Tamil Nadu..

concerned_dept: Finance Department
name: New Health Insurance Scheme
funding_pattern: 75% of the expenses or Rs.1.00 lakh whichever is less
how: Apply to the concerned Department
desc: Under this scheme a sum of Rs.10/- is recovered as subscription every month from the Government employee. Assistance to the tune of 75% of the expenses or Rs.1.00 lakh whichever is less is granted to those who apply for assistance with the documents relating to treatment taken for ailments approved under the scheme.

concerned_dept: Handlooms, Handicrafts, Textiles and Khadi Department
name: Handlooms  and  Textiles Department - Scheme for integrated textile parks(SITP) Under the Scheme for setting up of Integrated Textile Parks
funding_pattern:
Under the Scheme for setting up of Integrated Textile Parks, the 
Government of India provides Grant or equity limited to 40% of the 
project cost subject to a ceiling of Rs.40 crore for the textile projects. 
However, the combined equity  stake  of  Government  of  India  /            
State Government / State Industrial Development Corporation, if any, 
should not exceed 49%.
how:
Director of Welfare
 Schemes
 Of 
Handlooms
 and 
Textiles
 Department
desc:
Under the Scheme for setting up of Integrated Textile Parks, the 
Government of India provides Grant or equity limited to 40% of the 
project cost subject to a ceiling of Rs.40 crore for the textile projects. 
However, the combined equity  stake  of  Government  of  India  /            
State Government / State Industrial Development Corporation, if any, 
should not exceed 49%.

concerned_dept: Labour Welfare and Skill Development Department
name: Abolition of Bonded Labour System
how: Collector / Sub Collector / RDO
desc: Persons kept as bonded labour are released and rehabilitated by providing financial assistance as grant, to the tune of Rs.20,000/- Of this, a sum of Rs.1000/- each will be given immediately on relief from Bondage. Remaining (Rs.19,000/-) amount will be given for the rehabilitation through various kinds. Moreover House site pattas, houses under group housing scheme through IRDP, drinking water facility and Bank loan assistance are provided to them. Released bonded labour without any caste and creed .

desc: Schemes of Revenue dept Issue of certificate  (contd.) 12) Death Certificate Legal heirs

concerned_dept: Micro , Small and Medium Enterprises Department
name: Application for sanction of subsidy for the purchase of Generator Set
funding_pattern:
25%,  subject to a maximum
of Rs.1.50 lakhs
how: Apply to District Industries Centre
desc:
Generator Subsidy at 25% of the cost of
generator upto 125 KVA capacity, subject to a maximum
of Rs.1.50 lakhs would be eligible to micro, small and
medium manufacturing enterprises set up anywhere in the State

concerned_dept: Micro , Small and Medium Enterprises Department
name: Application for Special Capital (Investment) Subsidy
how: Apply to the District Industries Centre of Regional Joint Director, Chennai
desc:
A Special Capital Subsidy of 15% on the eligible
plant and machinery is extended to the 10 thrust sector
enterprises viz., Electrical and Electronic Industry,
Leather and Leather goods, Auto parts and components,
Drugs and Pharmaceuticals, Solar Energy Equipment,
Gold and Diamond Jewellery for exports, Pollution Control equipments, Sports Goods and Accessories,
Cost effective building material and Readymade
Garments. This Special Capital Subsidy is extended to
above enterprises set up anywhere in the State subject
to a maximum of Rs.30 lakhs.

concerned_dept: Micro , Small and Medium Enterprises Department
name: Application for State Capital Subsidy
how: Apply to District Industries Centre or Regional Joint Director, Chennai
desc:
15 % capital subsidy on the value of eligible
plant and machinery subject to a maximum of
Rs.3.75 lakhs.

concerned_dept: Tamil Dev. and  Information Department
name: Journalists Family Benefit Fund
funding_pattern: From Rs. 50,000 to Rs. 2 Lakhs.
how: Apply to Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department
desc: Journalists' Family Benefit Fund is given from the Chief Minister's Public Relief Fund to families of Journalists who have served in any of these capacities viz, editor, sub-editor, reporter, photographer, proof reader for 20 years and passed away while in service.

concerned_dept: Tamil Dev. and  Information Department
name: Journalists Family Pension
how: Apply to Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department
desc:
The monthly pension given to the wife of deceased journalist
pensioner

concerned_dept: Tamil Dev. and  Information Department
name: Journalists Medical Fund
funding_pattern: Upto Rs. 50,000/-
how: Apply to Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department
desc: Financial assistance to Journalists for medical treatment is  provided from the Chief Minister’s Public Relief Fund.

concerned_dept: Tamil Dev. and  Information Department
name: Journalists Pension
how: Apply to Tamil Development, Religious Endowment & Information Department
desc: The monthly pension of Rs.4000/- given to retired journalists who have served for 20 years and are in indigent circumstances

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Assistance for delivery of a child
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board
desc: To a registered  female Folk Artiste towards delivery for maximum of 2 children

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Assistance for Education
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board
desc: Assistance for education is provided to son/daughter of Folk Artiste subject to a maximum of 2 children starting from Class X to Post Graduate level and Professional Courses along with Hostel Fees depending upon the Course

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Assistance for Marriage
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board
desc: To meet the marriage expenses of the Folk Artiste or thier Son or daughter

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Assistance for miscarriage or Termination of Pregnancy
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board
desc: To a registerd female Folk Artiste towards hospital expenses for miscarriage or termination of pregnancy for maximum 2 times

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Assistance for purchase of Spectacles
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board.
desc: To the registered Folk Artistes

concerned_dept: Tourism,Culture and Religious Endowments Department
name: Death and Funeral Expenses
how: Apply to the Secretary, Tamil Nadu Folk Artistes Welfare Board.
desc: If a registered Folk Artiste dies naturally, a sum of Rs. 15000 will be given to the nominee of the deceasedand a sum of Rs. 2000 will be given to meet the funeral expenses.
